name: Sushil Sharma

academic_background.institution: TIFPA, National research center of INFN
Faculty of Physics, Astronomy and Applied Computer Science, Jagiellonian University
Faculty of Physics, University of Warsaw
Faculty of Physics, Astronomy and Applied Computer Science, Jagiellonian University
Tata Institute of Fundamental Research center (T.I.F.R)

research_interests: New hardware and software techniques and instrumentation in particle detection
research_activities_highlights: 2009-2021 in instrumentation, data acquisition, realization of nuclear physics experiments, in computer based raw data analysis and in model description of observables.

technical_skills.detectors: Working experiences with scintillation, silicon detectors. Extensive experiences in working with Germanium detectors.

awards_and_achievements: INFN Fellowship for non-italian citizens 2019/2020, INFN, Italy.
Distinction in PhD thesis titled as 'Validation of spallation models'.
Polish Ministry of Science and Higher Education Award - Stipend for Outstanding Achievements for academic year 2014/2015.

Scholarship in the framework of International PhD studies in applied nuclear physics and innovative technologies supported by the Foundation for Polish Science −MPD program, co-financed by the European Union within the European Regional development fund.
Awarded with Junior Research Fellowship in the Department of Nuclear and Atomic Physics for the period of 2009 −2011 in Tata Institute of Fundamental Research center (TIFR), Mumbai, India.

projects.description: Performed a Physics project during final year of master studies on 'Characteristics of Clover Detector'
projects.guide: Dr. Rakesh Kumar, scientist-F, GDA/INGA group

teaching_duties: 2017 - Present: Co-supervisor of a PhD student.
2013 - 2014: Laboratories exercises with Erasmus master student (ERASMUS).
